title: The Dream Encyclopedia (2009)
description:
The Dream Encyclopedia

James R. Lewis, Evelyn Dorothy Oliver 

Visible Ink Press | English | 2009-05-01 | ISBN: 157859216X | 450 pages | PDF | 8 MB










Exploring the fascinating world of dreams, this comprehensive reference examines more than 250 dream-related topics, from art to history to science, including how factors such as self-healing, ESP, literature, religion, sex, cognition and memory, and medical conditions can all have an effect on dreams. 


Dream symbolism and interpretation is examined in historical, cultural, and psychological detail, while a dictionaryÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½updated with 1,000 symbols and explanationsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½offers further insights. Dreaming about teeth, for instance, can indicate control issues, and dreaming of a zoo can indicate that the dreamer needs to tidy up some situation. Examining these concepts and more, this is the ultimate dreamer's companion.
